name: Macdonald Linden Hall Golf & Country Club

reviews.text: Myself and a friend attended here for a 'spa day' in October entitled winter Warner spa day. This was the most disappointing spa I have ever been to, on entering the spa we both knew it was not what we had expected. We had to wait almost 15 minutes for a member of staff to appear at the spa reception and when someone eventually did appear this was one of the therapist who told us we would have to wait as she was busy! We had already waited more than 10 minutes. When someone did eventually come to see us we were given towels and a robe (no spa slippers) which we had not been informed that we would not be getting therefore we had no footwear, our robe and towels given were also not really what we desired to be wearing on a "luxury spa day" they were grubby and well worn in.
reviews.title: Disappointing dirty spa and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were shown around the pool area by a member of staff who ventured in with his shoes on. On entering the changing rooms I was actually shocked they were so bad, they were dirty there was a wasp (in October) flying around, the toilet was filthy.
reviews.title: Superb value for a luxurious romantic break

reviews.text: The spa consisted on a swimming pool a mini jacuizi and a sauna and steam room. The steam room smelt awful and was so put dated and not really fit for use, the sauna was equally as bad and it was lucky there weren't many guests as both of these fitted no more than 4 people at a time. There were people walking around the spa area who seemed to work there however who did not have uniforms on and we were unsure whether these were staff or guests however I felt this made us uncomfortable and uneasy.
reviews.title: Disabled access to Craft day dissapointing
Watch your purses/wallet
reviews.text: We received our treatments from the therapist who had been abrupt to us on entering the spa however although the treatment was ok I would not say it is the best I have.

Lunch was in the linden tree pub which you have to walk across a car park to get to therefore have to get changed into your clothes (this is a pub which is not ajoined to the hotel or spa therefore there are other members of the public there) and are instructed to do so. Lunch was ok but again nothing special. We did have to option of returning to the spa after lunch however we didn't really want to after our morning experience and even if we had I wouldn't really have wanted to get changed into a wet swimming costume again.
reviews.title: On the ball

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Linden Hall sometime ago and was disappointed with the( room bathroom not very clean). We stayed again last week for 2 days on a special offer £99 per night dinner bed and breakfast. The room was an upgrade and a great size but I must admit theit did need a bit of TLC. The lock fell off our the bathroom door . Never the less the food was very good and the staff very friendly .Did not us the spa but played golf. A long course with a bit of walking between the tees. We hired a buggy for £25.00.Play the course weekends for £20 or week days £15.00 per round.Morpeth is olny 10 minutes away by carnice town lots of shops.Overall could not complain for the price we paid might have been a bit disappointed with we had paid the full rate .
reviews.title: Second Stay Golf Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend with my partner as we wanted to visit the area. We got a good rate for room only. The hotel is lovely from the outside but it is a but dated inside. We had a room on the ground floor which was a lovely big room and the bed was hugh and very comfortable, however the furniture and bathroom were a bit dated and we found the water scolding hot, which is better than it been freezing I supose!! We did use the spa which was nice but nothing special and did have the strange smell a few people mention! We ate at the Linden Tree Pub which was excellent the choice of food and the quality would make me visit the hotel again!! We thought this hotel was more like a nice 3 star than the 4 star it is, however the staff were friendly and I would stay again if I was in the area.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you get the right price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one night stay here in a twin room as a treat after attending a wedding nearby.
reviews.title: Disappointing in parts

reviews.text: We had a courtesy call from the company about 10 days before our visit asking if we had any special requests which we thought was a good start to our stay.
reviews.title: Staff were very friendly but macdonalds chain let the side down

reviews.text: I informed the caller that we would be an early evening check in and had no other requests. She said the hotel would be busy as there was a wedding on so we expected there to be lots of people about.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: 4 of us booked for the "play and pamper" round of golf and spa day on a Friday leaving on Saturday. On arrival at around midday we were told teeh rooms were not ready until 3:00 and so thought that we would have a coffee in the lounge , but were told that we should go to the Linden Pub which is on site as the restaurant in the hotel was not open. On arrival at the pub and asking for a coffee and some biscuits were told that biscuits were not available in the pub - only in the Hotel. Anyway had a coffee and lunch all of which was fine except would have preferred the Hotel ambience. The golf course is good and it wa snot busy so we (the males of the group) , had an enjoyable round of golf arriving back to pick up the ladies from the spa.
reviews.title: Golf and spar package

reviews.text: On arrival the Ladies were not finished so suggested that they had a glass of wine whilst we went to the Pub for a beer, however ordering a couple of glasses of wine proved problematical as the staff seemed more interested in talking to each other rather than serving the guests! Eventually one of them agreed to go to the bar (suggested my wife in dressing gown should go and get her own from the Pub !!) The treatments were fine but the general spa was jaded and in need of refurbishment and also some decent service.
reviews.title: If your hungry, don't book a meal here !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On booking into our room (one of the executive rooms downstairs) we could hear a constant noise and realised that this was due to the disco at the wedding reception. So asked to change rooms and got one of the standard rooms in the old building -- this was a much better room and the staff were lovely about changing -- message here don't pay extra for an executive room -- not worth it and you get the sound of the weddings!
reviews.title: efficient and good food

reviews.text: We eat in the restaurant as it was included in our deal -- we had to wait ages for any food -- priority seems to be given to the weddings and when it did arrive it was very small portions. Food itself was good but definitely not a adequate portion size!
reviews.title: Not a luxury hotel at all

reviews.text: So in summary -- nice grounds, good golf course - jaded spa and all rooms in need of refurbishment. Would i go back -- No overpriced for what you get even on one of the deals
reviews.title: Avoid staying if there's a wedding booked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit for a nigt at the Linden Hall, having been disappointed the first time and promised a better experience by the management.
reviews.title: Second visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was, the room was clean and well appointed, staff freindly and attentive, we ate at the Linden Tree pub in the grounds and the food was excellent although drinks fairly expensive.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: Would we stay again - based on this experience - Yes
reviews.title: Spa overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been for a wedding and although the building itself was beautiful the food at the wedding was extremely dissapointing. The vegetables was a combination of over cooked and undercooked, the meat was cold and fatty. The starter was ok but lukewarm, the dessert was classed as a brownie but it was more like a refrigerator cake. The wine was ok. The room was ok but the carpet stained. It had a sloping roof so when my partner got out of bed he kept hitting his head. We were only there one night otherwise I would have asked to be moved.The staff were professional but not overly friendly. We had not booked breakfast but after eating the meal we were pleased as otherwise to spend £17.50 after that meal we probably would have cancelled as it probably would not have been worth it.
reviews.title: Our thir visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the hotel automatically add £1 onto the bill for a charity donation that the chain 'supports'. This is not advertised or spoken about, however I noticed it and queried the rate and that is when they told me. There is leaflet attached to the card that you sign but they just handed the card with the leaflet attached and said to sign here, here and here. I know its only a £1 but its the fact that they do it without a verbal request and its automatically done for you and unless you read it and verbally opt out, no doubt in a reception it makes you slightly uncomfortable that you are seen as not been very charitable. I am chartiable and I choose my charities and donate on my own terms not because a hotel chain I am staying at for a wedding decides thats who I should donate to.
reviews.title: Great Location for visiting Nothumbria

aka: Macdonald Linden Hall Golf And Country Club
